page.title: 07FARMING (First page)
page.content: { LAND USE AND FARMING. {GENERAL. This is a rural area. The farm land is used mainly for grazing beef cattle, sheep and some dairy cattle. The ares has many steep sided valleys which are only suitable for grazing sheep. The steeper slopes of the valleys are wooded. The Sterridge Valley is a particularly beautiful valley with grazing land and many wooded slopes. the upper part of the valley belongs to Eggesford Forest and has been planted with conifer trees. Some of the farms in the area grow a little corn and use grass for hay and silage. There are few other arable crops grown.Other animals kept in small numbers on some of the farms are, goats for milk, pigs,sheep dogs,chickens,horses and donkeys for riding,and cats. {cont next page
